newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan shortens No.4 cracker maintenance shutdown.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan shortens No.4 cracker maintenance shutdown.

text.p: Taiwan state monopoly Chinese Petroleum Corp said on Wednesday it would shorten an annual 60-day maintenance shutdown of its No.4 naphtha cracker to allow for minor repairs on its No.3 cracker.
"Chinese Petroleum is trying to shorten the No.4 naphtha cracker maintenance to keep product supplies at normal levels," a monopoly official said by telephone.
Taiwan's Commercial Times reported on Wednesday that the shutdown would be reduced by 15 to 20 days.
The company official said the report was approximately correct but would not give a specific duration for the closure.
The monopoly's No.3 cracker has annual production capacity of 230,000 tonnes of ethylene while the No.4 cracker can produce 385,000 tonnes.
Its No.5 cracker can make 400,000 tonnes of ethylene.
Its No.1 cracker was closed in 1990 and No.2 plant in April 1994. -- Taipei Newsroom (2-5080815)
